content.text: This temperature is \(11^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) higher than the temperature at \(01 00\)
Jodi swims 22 lengths of a swimming pool to raise money for charity
She receives \(\) 15\(for each length she swims
Calculate how much money Jodi raises for charity
Write the recurring decimal \(0.23\) as a fraction
A tourist changes \(\) 500\(to euros (€) when the exchange rate is\) \mathfrak{E}1 = \$ 1.0697

content.text: Calculate how many euros he receives

content.text: The probability that a sweet made in a factory is the wrong shape is 0.0028
One day, the factory makes 25 000 sweets
Calculate the number of sweets that are expected to be the wrong shape
The bearing of Alexandria from Paris is \(128^{\circ}\)
Calculate the bearing of Paris from Alexandria
Find the position vector of \(B\), in terms of \(\mathbf{x}\) and \(\mathbf{y}\), in its simplest form
Calculate the total surface area of the cuboid
The number of passengers on a train increases from 63 to 77
A cone with height \(14.8 \text{cm}\) has volume \(275 \text{cm}^3\)
Calculate the radius of the cone
[The volume, \(V,\) of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h.\) ]
Eric invests an amount in a bank that pays compound interest at a rate of \(2.16\%\) per year
At the end of 5 years, the value of his investment is \(6 999.31\)
\(A, B\) and \(C\) are points on the circle, centre \(O\)
By drawing a suitable tangent, estimate the gradient of the curve at the point \(P\)
A pipe is full of water
The cross-section of the pipe is a circle, radius 2.6 cm
Water flows through the pipe into a tank at a speed of 12 centimetres per second
Calculate the number of litres that flow into the tank in one hour
Find the value of \(x\) when the determinant of \(\begin{pmatrix} 3 & - 1 \\ - 7 & x \end{pmatrix}\) is 5
Without using a calculator, work out \(3\frac{1}{8}\div \frac{5}{12}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
the acceleration during the first 15 seconds,
the distance travelled in the 50 seconds
The speed–time graph shows the first 50 seconds of a journey
Find the co-ordinates of the midpoint of \(AB\)
Find the equation of the line through \(A\) that is perpendicular to \(AB\)
Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\)
\(A\) is the point (2, 3) and \(B\) is the point (7, \(- 5\) )
